title: Casteller NV Rosé Brut Trepat (Cava)
description: A dark and rusty color combined with leafy red-fruit aromas gets this Trepat Cava going. A pulling palate borders on astringent, while leafy, slightly bitter citrus flavors are rustic and match the nose.

title: Château Feytit-Clinet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. This wine is firmly structured with rich blackberry fruit notes. A flavor of bitter chocolate gives the wine a burnt toast edge that needs to soften if the wine is to come together.

title: Château la Vieille France 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. Black currant dominates this bright and fruity wine. It has soft tannins and attractive acidity. This light wine will mature quickly.

title: Château Lapinesse 2017 Barrel Sample Cuvée Prestige  (Graves)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. This is a bright wine with fine acidity and crisp black currant notes. It has a light structure giving it a soft aftertaste; this is juicy with attractive fruitiness.

title: Château d'Arcins 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. This wine is austere, with dry tannins and acidity more than black currant fruits. That gives the wine a lean character, which will probably remain.

title: Altavins 2016 Ilercavònia Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Snappy aromas of tangerine lead to a chunky palate with thickness as well as cutting acidity. This tastes of dried melon and bitterness, while on the finish it's chunky, with distant flavors of green melon.

title: Castellani 2015 Monsalaia  (Maremma Toscana)
description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, tilled soil and a whiff of cooking spice. The round easygoing palate shows ripe black fruit and vanilla alongside ripe tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Perlat Syrah (Montsant)
description: Raisiny aromas indicate that this Syrah is a bit overripe and lazy. Its big, bulky palate is weighty but unfocused, with a jammy berry flavor profile backed by a plump finish.

title: Château Ladignac 2015  Médoc
description: Produced by the local cooperative, this estate wine has strong high-toast wood flavors that happily are balanced by juicy blackberry flavors and acidity. The wine, with its dusty texture, should age relatively quickly. Drink from 2021.

title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Ripe cherry notes on the nose have a conifer edge. The palate has ample freshness but also seems to lack a little focus. This is full-fruited and fresh. Drink soon.

title: Etablissements Thunevin 2015 Mauvais Garçon  (Bordeaux)
description: Jean-Luc Thunevin was known as the “bad boy” (Mauvais Garçon) of Saint-Émilion because he was a main instigator of the garagiste movement. This wine is delicious, fresh, crisp and immediately drinkable. Black fruits are soft, ripe and open. Enjoy now.

title: Fattoria San Felo 2015 Balla La Vecchia  (Maremma Toscana)
description: A blend in equal parts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and cooking spice. The lively palate offers cherry jam, tangerine and mocha alongside supple tannins.

title: Flowers 2015 Camp Meeting Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a persistent bitter note that's part earthy, part savory and a touch extreme. Rhubarb, rose, black tea and cardamom all figure in, but don't get along all together well.

title: Giancarlo Ceci 2016 Parchitello Bombino Nero Rosato (Castel del Monte)
description: Brandied cherry juice and crushed herbs have a slightly saucy feel in this Rosato from the thin-skinned Bombino Nero. There's nice weight to the palate, which boasts flavors of strawberry jam and additional herbs, alongside soft acidity in the background.

title: Grizzly Peak 2014 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)
description: Though considerably higher in finished alcohol than the previous vintage, this still carries an impression of underripe fruit. It's tart, thin and tannic, lightly cloaked in baking spices from barrel aging.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2016 Montado White (Alentejano)
description: Light and fruity, this wine is soft and creamy. Apple and green-plum-skin flavors are perfumed, lightly textured and offer balanced acidity. This easy wine is ready to drink.

title: Maryhill 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine comes off as a bit green out of the gate, with aromas of mortared fresh herb along with blueberry, woodspice and vanilla. Flavors are soft and light, concentrated in the middle but missing at the edges. The tannins bring a lightly gritty feel.

title: Maset del Lleó NV Castell de Sant Pau Sparkling (Cava)
description: A mild nose offers bready aromas. The plump, foamy palate delivers short, briny flavors of generic citrus fruits in front of a clean finish with no complexity. Enjoy this in casual situations, or blended with fruit juice.

title: Melrose 2015 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: Lightly earthy, this offers pleasant berry fruit, though it comes across as more generic than specific to the variety. There's a light touch of toast also, perhaps from the barrel aging. Drink up over the next couple of years.

title: Merriam 2013 Windacre Vineyard Estate Merlot (Russian River Valley)
description: Dull aromatics open the way to thick dense red fruit, oak and a thickness of tannin in this estate-driven red which drinks heavy on the palate. Cedar and pencil shavings accent it well.

title: Messina Hof NV Angel Late Harvest Reisling Riesling (Texas)
description: Heady aromas of canned peach, kumquat and pollen convey the awaiting playful sweetness. The confected palate shows flavors of ripe yellow peach, candied mandarin and quince. This wine is plush with just enough acidity to keep it from becoming cloying, while flavors of Satsuma and honeydew melon carry through the medium-short finish.

title: Montemercurio 2011 Mssaggero  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Used leather, underbrush scorched earth and toasted aromas slowly appear on this evolved wine. The mature palate shows prune and the heat of evident alcohol. It's seen better days for sure. Drink sooner rather than later before it dries out completely.

title: Nottola 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this has aromas suggesting moist forest floor, truffle, cassis and a whiff of graphite. The palate is on the lean side, offering suggestions of blackberry, orange rind, game and star anise alongside dusty, rather fleeting tannins and firm acidity.

title: Pepi Lignana 2013 Poggio Colombi  (Maremma Toscana)
description: This opens with delicate aromas of black plum and baking spice. The simple palate delivers vanilla, prune and star anise alongside round tannins.

title: Portal del Priorat 2014 Gotes Grenache-Carignan (Montsant)
description: Medicinal berry and plum aromas result in a latex scent. High acidity creates pinching and narrowness on a palate with plum and berry flavors that are more racy and red than dark and ripe. Edgy tannins resurface on a raw finish.

title: San Marzano 2013 Talò Red (Salice Salentino)
description: This ultraripe blend of 85% Negroamaro and 15% Malvasia Nera is jammy in black- and red-fruit aromas, with sweet baking spice aromas peppered throughout. The palate feels thick, with black fruit tones under a sheen of cocoa dust and licorice. A bit of acidity helps clean things up come the finish.

title: San Marzano 2016 Il Pumo Negroamaro (Salento)
description: Rich and fruity, this bargain buy shows strawberry and blackberry jam aromas and flavors, speckled with green herb and floral tones. There's some breadth to the palate from the ripe fruit, yet enough tannic grip and acidity to maintain balance.

title: Sunset Hills 2016 Sunset Red (Virginia)
description: Primarily Cabernet Franc, this blend has pleasing aromas of cranberry, plum, lavender, mint and licorice. There is also a charred oak note that carries through onto the palate and overpowers the other flavors. Zippy acidity adds a welcome freshness that cuts though some of the rough tannins. The finish is long and woody.

title: Triacca 2014 Sassella  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Aromas suggesting underbrush and smoke carry over to the simple palate along with raw cranberry and a hint of clove. It's light bodied, with racy acidity and a lean finish.

title: Valdipiatta 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Aromas of stewed prune and toasted notes lead the nose on this brawny red. Searing alcohol dominates the palate and throws it off balance while blackberry extract, licorice and toasted oak notes linger in the background. Grainy tannins give it an astringent finish.
